intro: Dianthus syriacus, commonly known as the Syrian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a white or yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and linear, arranged alternately along the stem. Dianthus syriacus is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
